channel.title: Fighting In The War Room
channel.itunes:summary: Prolific film and culture critics Katey Rich, Matt Patches, Da7e Gonzales and David Ehrlich take on pop culture topics, film and TV reviews and interview very special guests in bi-weekly installments.
channel.itunes:author: Katey, Matt, Da7e and David
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Movies and Pop-Culture Podcast

item.title: Top Tens 2015
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: The Sixth Annual Top Ten Show! It’s that time of year again: time to make a list! Katey, Patches and David all have their top ten films of the year and Da7e will host a countdown episode while throwing in his Top 5 of the year. If we’ve previously mentioned or reviewed these films they’ve […]
item.content:encoded:
The Sixth Annual Top Ten Show!

It’s that time of year again: time to make a list! Katey, Patches and David all have their top ten films of the year and Da7e will host a countdown episode while throwing in his Top 5 of the year.

If we’ve previously mentioned or reviewed these films  they’ve all been tagged at our website as Top Ten 2015 episodes! Upcoming reviews, like The Hateful Eight, will also have this tag added.

CLICK HERE or point your browser to http://fightinginthewarroom.com/tag/top-ten-2015/ for those episodes.

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Katey (@KateyRich),  Patches (@misterpatches), Da7e (@da7e) and David (@davidehrlich ).

CALL IN and leave us a voicemail! You could be part of the show!  (914) 410-6450

Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear! 

FORMAT

00:00 – Introduction and Format

3:47 – Da7e #5

7:48 – #10s

21:07 – #9s

31:24 – Da7e #4

37:53 – #8s

50:42 – #7s

01:02:29 – Da7e #3

1:03:33 – #6s

1:13:03 – #5s

1:22:03 – Da7e #2

1:23:12 – #4s

1:31:03 – #3s

1:37:08 – Da7e #1

1:42:54 – #2s

1:48:21 – #1s and Outro

Lists

 

KATEY

1. Son of Saul
2. Spotlight
3. Room
4. Phoenix
5. Mistress America
6. Diary of a Teenage Girl
7. Mad Max: Fury Road
8. Grandma
9. Creed
10. The Martian

PATCHES

1. 45 Years
2. Anomalisa
3. Mad Max
4. Hateful Eight
5. A Pigeon Sat on a Branch Reflecting on Existence
6. Ex Machina
7. While We’re Young/Mistress America
8. The Look of Silence
9. Spotlight
10. The Big Short

DAVID

1. Carol
2. World of Tomorrow
3. Phoenix
4. The Look of Silence
5. A Pigeon Sat on a Branch Reflecting on Existence
6. The Duke of Burgundy
7. Eden
8. Kumiko the Treasure Hunter
9. Mistress America
10. Mad Max: Fury Road

DA7E

1. Anomalisa
2. Carol
3. Mad Max: Fury Road
4. Ex Machina
5. Inside Out

item.itunes:author: Katey, Matt, Da7e and David

item.title: STAR WARS SPECIAL – Episode 3: Attack of the Awakening!
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: An All FORCE AWAKENS Episode The Fighting In The War Room podcast family acknowledges that Star Wars Mania is here to stay now that Disney-purchased Lucasfilm plans to spin the saga and anthology movies out into the foreseeable future. It’s time to fight in the galactic war room. In the third Star Wars Special, Katey […]
item.content:encoded:
An All FORCE AWAKENS Episode

The Fighting In The War Room podcast family acknowledges that Star Wars Mania is here to stay now that Disney-purchased Lucasfilm plans to spin the saga and anthology movies out into the foreseeable future. It’s time to fight in the galactic war room.

In the third Star Wars Special, Katey Rich, Joanna Robinson, Neil Miller and Da7e question Matt Patches about his attempt to avoid all information about Star Wars: The Force Awakens not only in 2015, but for the three years since we knew it was coming. READ HIS ARTICLE ABOUT IT HERE. What was still a surprise? What was unavoidable and what wasn’t as fun as it should be?

Then, the conversation devolves into everyone asking specific  questions about The Force Awakens with each other. You know, the thing you and your friends have been doing since you saw the movie anyway.

A Note on SPOILERS: This podcast ASSUMES you have seen The Force Awakens.

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Da7e (@da7e)  Patches (@misterpatches), Joanna (@jowrotethis), Neil Miller (@rejects) and Katey (@kateyrich) .

Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear!

FORMAT

00:00 – It’s A Star Wars Special!

02:10 –   Intro

04:26 –  SPOILERS, Avoiding Them, Knowing Them, Loving The Force Awakens.

1:17:28 – Outro
item.itunes:subtitle: An All FORCE AWAKENS Episode The Fighting In The War Room podcast family acknowledges that Star Wars Mania is here to stay now that Disney-purchased Lucasfilm plans to spin the saga and anthology movies out into the foreseeable future.

item.title: Review – Star Wars: The Force Awakens
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: Fighting in the Star Wars Room This week, David, Patches, Da7e and Katey have all seen J.J. Abrams’ Star Wars: The Force Awakens. You probably have too! If you have, you want to talk about it. If you haven’t, prepare to pause this episode or delve into spoilers. Yes, spoilers. The first 29 minutes and […]
item.content:encoded:
Fighting in the Star Wars Room

This week, David, Patches, Da7e and Katey have all seen J.J. Abrams’ Star Wars: The Force Awakens. You probably have too! If you have, you want to talk about it. If you haven’t, prepare to pause this episode or delve into spoilers.
Yes, spoilers. The first 29 minutes and 42 seconds of this podcast are SPOILER FREE.
Then there is a lightsaber and the spoilers come fast and hard with more than usual amount of tangental cross-talk (it was hard only talking to a handful of people about this movie)

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Katey (@kateyrich), Patches (@misterpatches), and David (@davidehrlich).

Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear! We read new reviews on the show!

NOTE: 29:42 – Begin Spoiler Section.

item.title: STAR WARS SPECIAL – Episode 2: Revenge of the New Hopes
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: Plus The Force Awakens speculations The Fighting In The War Room podcast family acknowledges that Star Wars Mania is here to stay now that Disney-purchased Lucasfilm plans to spin the saga and anthology movies out into the foreseeable future. It’s time to fight in the galactic war room. In the second Star Wars Special, Matt […]
item.content:encoded:
Plus The Force Awakens speculations

The Fighting In The War Room podcast family acknowledges that Star Wars Mania is here to stay now that Disney-purchased Lucasfilm plans to spin the saga and anthology movies out into the foreseeable future. It’s time to fight in the galactic war room.

In the second Star Wars Special, Matt Patches (who has managed to avoid all information about the Force Awakens except that the Millennium Falcon is in it) and Joanna Robinson engage with Da7e on what level of Star Wars minutiae is a step too far. Trivia? Expanded Universe? Then, Katey Rich and Joanna entertain Da7e’s R2-D2 theory as a way of talking about how to improve the prequels.

Then – This is the LAST PODCAST RECORDED before everyone sees The Force Awakens! – it’s finally time for The Storm of Spoilers crew to apply their Game of Thrones Citadel of Crazytown to Episode VII. No one has actually seen the movie, but everyone has questions. Then, the hosts brainstorm possible titles for Episode VIII.

A Note on SPOILERS: On a scale from Mister Patches (knowing nothing) to Storm of Spoilers (spoiling everything), this episode’s final segment TOTAL SPOILAGE POSSIBLE. There will be a GONG SOUND 1 hour and 27 minutes in in to warn you when that the speculation is about to happen. 

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Da7e (@da7e)  Patches (@misterpatches), Joanna (@jowrotethis), Neil Miller (@rejects) and Katey (@kateyrich) .

Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear!

FORMAT

00:00 – It’s A Star Wars Special!

02:10 –   Intro

04:18 –  RETENTION QUIZ – Revenge of the Sith Vs. Katey

17:56 –  RETENTION QUIZ – A New Hope Vs. Neil

32:08 - How Much Star Wars is Too Much Star Wars (Expanded Universe)

57:06 – R2-D2, Withholding Droid and What You’d Change About the Prequels

1:27:35 –  SPOILER GONG! The Force Awakens Spoiler/Speculation Free-For-All

2:13:56 – Outro
item.itunes:subtitle: Plus The Force Awakens speculations The Fighting In The War Room podcast family acknowledges that Star Wars Mania is here to stay now that Disney-purchased Lucasfilm plans to spin the saga and anthology movies out into the foreseeable future.

item.title: Review – The Big Short
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: The financial sky is falling This week, David, Patches, and Katey bet against the banks, make a billion dollars, then quit the podcasting business. Just kidding. They made a billion dollars and decided to review The Big Short. They also pick answers to a lightning round question about celebrity cameos. Take a listen, embed and/or […]
item.content:encoded:
The financial sky is falling

This week, David, Patches, and Katey bet against the banks, make a billion dollars, then quit the podcasting business. Just kidding. They made a billion dollars and decided to review The Big Short. They also pick answers to a lightning round question about celebrity cameos.

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Katey (@kateyrich), Patches (@misterpatches), and David (@davidehrlich).

Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear! We read new reviews on the show!

Music

“Higher and Higher” by Craig Wedren

item.title: STAR WARS SPECIAL – Episode One: A Phantom Jedi Awakening Menace
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: The Phantom Menace > Return of the Jedi The Fighting In The War Room podcast family acknowledges that Star Wars Mania is here to stay now that Disney-purchased Lucasfilm plans to spin the saga and anthology movies out into the foreseeable future. It’s time to fight in the galactic war room. In the first of […]
item.content:encoded:
The Phantom Menace > Return of the Jedi

The Fighting In The War Room podcast family acknowledges that Star Wars Mania is here to stay now that Disney-purchased Lucasfilm plans to spin the saga and anthology movies out into the foreseeable future. It’s time to fight in the galactic war room. In the first of our Star Wars specials, Joanna Robinson from Vanity Fair‘s Hollywood (and the Thought Bubble and Storm of Spoilers podcasts) takes a quiz to recall The Phantom Menace followed by spoiler-phobe Matt Patches’ quiz to recall Return of the Jedi. Then, the two lock horns like two sons of Dathomir to debate Patches’ theory that The Phantom Menace is a better movie than Return of the Jedi. Finally, Katey stops by to kick Patches out and finally talk freely about The Force Awakens for the first time on a FITWR podcast.

A Note on SPOILERS: On a scale from Mister Patches (knowing nothing) to Storm of Spoilers (spoiling everything), this episode’s final segment is in the middle. There will be a GONG SOUND 22 minutes in to warn you when that the speculation is about to happen. The rest of the podcast is spoiler free! 

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Da7e (@da7e)  Patches (@misterpatches), Joanna (@jowrotethis) and Katey (@kateyrich) .

Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear!

FORMAT

00:00 – It’s A Star Wars Special!

01:25 –   Intro

03:01 –  RETENTION QUIZ – The Phantom Menace Vs. Joanna

14:00 –  RETENTION QUIZ – Return of the Jedi Vs. Patches

28:36 – The Phantom Menace > Return of the Jedi

22:11 –  SPOILER GONG! Living in a Force Awakens world w/o having seen The Force Awakens

1:21:36 – Outro
item.itunes:subtitle: The Phantom Menace > Return of the Jedi The Fighting In The War Room podcast family acknowledges that Star Wars Mania is here to stay now that Disney-purchased Lucasfilm plans to spin the saga and anthology movies out into the foreseeable future.

item.title: 99 – You’ll Die Before Your E-mail Does
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: Circling back to Spotlight and listening to critic’s circles This week, the podcasters have lost Da7e to a galaxy far, far away, so Katey, Patches and David talk about the “Best of” lists that have been released thus far and if they have captured 2015′s year in movies. Then, Patches has an odd question for […]
item.content:encoded:
Circling back to Spotlight and listening to critic’s circles

This week, the podcasters have lost Da7e to a galaxy far, far away, so Katey, Patches and David talk about the “Best of” lists that have been released thus far and if they have captured 2015′s year in movies. Then, Patches has an odd question for the other two hosts before all three circle back to talk about the currently-in-release journalism movie Spotlight from director Thomas McCarthy. That, plus a Lightning Round question about celebrity cameos.

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Katey (@kateyrich) Da7e (@da7e)  Patches (@misterpatches), and David (@davidehrlich or @CriterionCorner).

Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear!

FORMAT

00:00 – Lightning Round: Celeb Cameo De Jour

01:25 –   Intro: Welcome To Episode 99!  Reviews

03:03 –  Tidbit: The Best Of Lists Thus Far

16:23 – Mini Segment: E-mail

22:11 –  Segment 3: Spotlight

41:11 – Outro

Music:

This episode’s music is from Ren & Stimpy Production Music Vol 1, 3 and 5.

item.title: Review – Carol
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: Really good or the best? This week, Katey, David, Patches and Da7e convene to talk about what is most likely David Ehrlich’s number one movie of the year: Carol. The Todd Haynes directed lesbian love story is set in the 1950s and features Rooney Mara meeting Cate Blanchett’s Carol. You seen the tweets, now hear […]
item.content:encoded:
Really good or the best?

This week, Katey, David, Patches and Da7e convene to talk about what is most likely David Ehrlich’s number one movie of the year: Carol. The Todd Haynes directed lesbian love story is set in the 1950s and features Rooney Mara meeting Cate Blanchett’s Carol. You seen the tweets, now hear the review.

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Katey (@kateyrich), Patches (@misterpatches), Da7e (@da7e) and David (@davidehrlich).

Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear! We read new reviews on the show!

item.title: 98 – 2015′s Flops: Trancing in the Bedroom
item.dc:creator: Da7e
item.description: Plus Indie Spirits and Transparent Returns to Amazon. This week, the podcasters have lost David to what they can only assume is Carol-related madness. Katey, Patches and Da7e kick off the final month in the Year of Our Time Lord Dr. Emmett Brown by discussing the Independent Spirit Award nominees that came out this week […]
item.content:encoded:
Plus Indie Spirits and Transparent Returns to Amazon.

This week, the podcasters have lost David to what they can only assume is Carol-related madness. Katey, Patches and Da7e kick off the final month in the Year of Our Time Lord Dr. Emmett Brown by discussing the Independent Spirit Award nominees that came out this week and how they have instilled Da7e with a fear that he hasn’t seen enough movies. Then, Katey gives big props to Amazon’s second season of Transparent that you can watch this weekend. Finally, the trio talk about the year of 2015 flops inspired by Victor Frankenstein and Jem and the Holograms. Why did so many movies this year not work?

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Katey (@kateyrich) Da7e (@da7e)  Patches (@misterpatches), and David (@davidehrlich or @CriterionCorner).

Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear!

FORMAT

00:00 – Lightning Round: Kreepy Krampus

01:17 –   Intro: Welcome To Episode 98!  

03:29 –  Tidbit: Independent Spirit Award Nominees

17:44 – Mini Segment: Transparent Season 2

24:44 –  Segment 3: 2015′s Year of Flops

44:18 – Outro

Music:

Tidbit

Mini

Seg 3/Outro
item.itunes:subtitle: Plus Indie Spirits and Transparent Returns to Amazon. This week, the podcasters have lost David to what they can only assume is Carol-related madness. Katey, Patches and Da7e kick off the final month in the Year of Our Time Lord Dr.
item.itunes:summary:
Plus Indie Spirits and Transparent Returns to Amazon. This week, the podcasters have lost David to what they can only assume is Carol-related madness. Katey, Patches and Da7e kick off the final month in the Year of Our Time Lord Dr. Emmett Brown by discussing the Independent Spirit Award nominees that came out this week and how they have instilled Da7e with a fear that he hasn't seen enough movies. Then, Katey gives big props to Amazon's second season of Transparent that you can watch this weekend. Finally, the trio talk about the year of 2015 flops inspired by Victor Frankenstein and Jem and the Holograms. Why did so many movies this year not work?
Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Katey (@kateyrich) Da7e (@da7e) Patches (@misterpatches), and David (@davidehrlich or @CriterionCorner). Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear!
FORMAT 00:00 - Lightning Round: Kreepy Krampus 01:17 - Intro: Welcome To Episode 98! 03:29 - Tidbit: Independent Spirit Award Nominees
17:44 - Mini Segment: Transparent Season 2 24:44 - Segment 3: 2015's Year of Flops
44:18 - Outro
Music: Tidbit Mini Seg 3/Outro

item.content:encoded:
With Arms Wide Open

This week, Katey and David strap on boxing gloves to duke it out over Creed, the seventh, reboot-ish installment of the Rocky franchise. Plus, they read answers to a Stallone-themed lightning round question.

Take a listen, embed and/or download below; for more from all of us on Twitter: follow the show (@FITWR), Katey (@kateyrich), Patches (@misterpatches), and David (@davidehrlich).

Please subscribe on iTunes and KICK US A REVIEW if you like what you hear! We read new reviews on the show!

Music

“Higher and Higher” by Craig Wedren
